Cobnut.name: 榛子 Cobnut
Cobnut.description:
榛子可以用于多种菜肴，从烘焙食品（如挞和饼干），到制成酱汁为多种菜肴点缀，再到多种形式的沙拉。

Hazelnuts can be used in multiple dishes, from baked goods, like tarts and cookies, made into a sauce to garnish multiple dishes, to multiple forms of salads.

Rose Gold.name: 玫瑰金 Rose Gold
Rose Gold.description:
玫瑰金是通过将纯金与铜结合制成的，在专业珠宝中很受欢迎。它比纯金更具延展性，使其成为白银匠偏好的材料，并且它比黄金或白金更便宜。

Rose gold, created by combining pure gold and copper, is popular in specialized jewelry. It is more malleable than pure gold, making it a preferred material for whitesmiths, and it is less expensive than gold or white gold.

Witches Brew.name: 女巫酿剂 Witches Brew
Witches Brew.description:
幼崽们爱不释手，甚至一些年长的人也会为了怀旧而来上一大杯，有时还会被调皮的酒馆老板悄悄掺进一滴香料白兰地。围绕它还有一些传说。有人说，如果你在收获月下把杯子搅动三次，就会在泡沫里瞥见你未来爱人的脸。我在哈森谷地试过一次。我得到的只有黏乎乎的鼻子，以及一直在旁边看着我的酿酒师女儿的一阵笑声。也许这就算是足够的魔法了。

Younglings adore it, and even some of the older folk take a mug for nostalgia, sometimes with a drop of spiced brandy slipped in by a cheeky tavern keeper. There are stories tied to it. Some say if you stir your cup thrice under the harvest moon you’ll glimpse the face of your future love in the foam. I tried once in Harthen Hollow. All I got was a sticky nose and a laugh from the brewer’s daughter who had been watching me the whole time. Maybe that counts as magic enough.

Pure Day.name: 纯净日 Pure Day
Pure Day.description:
纯日通常只是普通平民在热浪期间继续饮酒的一个拙劣借口。这种酿造物本身并不烈，味道类似清凉的柠檬水，但基底是麦酒。有个经久不衰的传闻声称，当它与晨风和永夜混合时，会赐予不朽。但考虑到配方的变动性，这听起来完全像是编造的谎言。

Pure Day is usually a poor excuse for the regular commoner to keep drinking during a heatwave. The brew itself is not strong, and it resembles, in taste, a cooling lemonade, but the base is ale. One persistent rumor claims that when combined with Morning Breeze and Evernight, it grants immortality. But considering the variation of the recipe, this sounds outright like a fabricated lie.

Mystery Soup.name: 谜之汤 Mystery Soup
Mystery Soup.description:
与“猎物之肉”类似，这种汤是用当天狩猎剩下的边角料做成的。它通常被用来挑战那些自称能毫无后果地吃下任何东西的冒险者，或作为给新来的顾客的入会仪式，用来逗乐酒馆老板和其他客人，因为新来者并不知情。

Similar to Meat of the Hunt, this soup is made from the leftovers of the day's hunt. It is mostly offered as a challenge for adventurers who claim they can eat anything without repercussions or as a hazing ritual for new patrons, providing amusement for the tavern keeper and other guests, as the new comers don't know better.

Henbane.name: 莨菪 Henbane
Henbane.description:
莨菪，又被称为女巫之草，是一种剧毒植物，类似于颠茄；然而，草药师会将其与大量其他植物结合，用来制作麻醉剂出售给任何医疗从业者。莨菪也是一种用于仪式的草药，被魔法师和治疗者用于以烟进行的仪式净化，以及用于调配混合药剂、爱情媚药和“飞行软膏”。

The Henbane, also known as the Witches Plant, is a highly toxic plant, similar to the nightshade, however, herbalists use it, in combination with a plethora of other plants, to create anesthetic for sale for any medical practitioners. The Henbane is also a ritualistic herb, being used by magicians and healers in ritual purifications by smoke as well as in the preparation of concoctions, love philters, and 'flying ointments'.

Electrum.name: 琥珀金 Electrum
Electrum.description:
如果是人造的，有时被称为绿金；如果是天然存在的合金，则被称为白金。主要由金和银组成。在大多数城市，用于制造琥珀金币或金条的金银比例大致为50-50；然而，在更偏远的地区会使用更高比例的银。由于这一点，大多数地区已经完全停止使用琥珀钱币，因为它们与大城市的制造风格一致。

Sometimes referred to as Green Gold if manufactured, or White Gold, if it is a naturally occurring alloy. Primarily composed of Gold and Silver. In most cities, the balance between gold and silver is roughly 50-50 for the Electrum coin or bars manufacturing, however, in the more remote areas a higher percentage of silver is used. Due to this, most regions have stopped using Electrum coins altogether, as they match the big cities' manufacturing style.

Scheelite.name: 白钨矿 Scheelite
Scheelite.description:
白钨矿宝石的色泽从浅黄色到橙色不等，适合切割刻面、切片与抛光，因此非常适合用于镶嵌工艺。更大且形状不规则的标本通常镶嵌于银饰中作为吊坠，或用于家具装饰。

Scheelite gemstones are found in shades ranging from pale yellow to orange and are suitable for faceting, slicing, and polishing, making them ideal for inlay work. Larger, irregular specimens are commonly mounted in silver as pendants or used for furniture ornamentation.

Peanut.name: 花生 Peanut
Peanut.description:
与普遍看法相反，花生并不长在树上，它们像土豆或洋葱一样被栽培。煮花生或烤花生是一种非常受欢迎的零食。在磨坊里，花生也可以被制成花生油或花生粉，这些通常用于烹饪。

Contrary to popular belief, peanuts don't grow on trees, they are cultivated as potatoes or onions. Boiled or roasted peanuts are a very popular snack. At mills, the peanut can be also turned into peanut oil or flour which are commonly used in cooking.

Cendal.name: 森达尔 Cendal
Cendal.description:
一种轻质丝绸，主要用于制作礼仪服装和教会礼服，并用于装饰旗帜。

A form of lightweight silk mainly used to make ceremonial clothing, and church vestments, and help with the decoration of banners.

Cake.name: 蛋糕 Cake
Cake.description:
蛋糕是一种烘焙甜点，由面粉、糖和其他原料混合制成。在其最早的形态中，蛋糕是面包的变体，但如今它们有着广泛的准备方式，既可以简单也可以精致。面包店通常会为周年纪念、婚礼或生日等活动按订单制作蛋糕。根据具体情况，制作蛋糕的过程可能复杂且耗时，可能需要几小时，在极少数情况下甚至接近一天。蛋糕可以包含新鲜水果、果酱、牛奶，甚至可以浸泡在果汁中以增加风味。在大多数情况下，蛋糕会覆盖冷的加糖奶油，并用额外的水果或其他配料进行装饰。 

Cake is a baked dessert made from a mixture of flour, sugar, and other ingredients. In their earliest forms, cakes were variations of bread, but today they come in a wide range of preparations that can be simple or elaborate. Bakeries usually make cakes to order for events such as anniversaries, weddings, or birthdays. Depending on the situation, the process of making a cake can be complex and time-consuming, taking anywhere from a few hours to in rare occasions close to a day. Cakes can contain fresh fruits, jams, milk, and can even be soaked in juice for additional flavor. In most cases, the cake is covered in cold sweetened cream and decorated with additional fruits or other toppings.

Book of Pawns.name: 棋子书 Book of Pawns
Book of Pawns.description:
《棋子之书》是一本名字诙谐的巨著，收录了一系列双关语，旨在让即便是最严肃的人也会呻吟出声。一些绝佳的例子包括：“如果你向一只树人寻求人生建议会怎样？他会告诉你要分枝拓展然后离开。”或“为什么那只狗头人的单口喜剧表演砸了？——他们的笑话拖得太长。”

"Book of Pawns" is a humorously named tome containing a collection of puns designed to make even the most stoic individuals groan. Some prime examples include: "What happens if you ask a treant for life advice? He’ll tell you to branch out and leave." or "Why did the kobold’s stand-up act bomb? - Their jokes drag on."

Jackhammer.name: 风镐 Jackhammer
Jackhammer.description:
风镐是一种气动、蒸汽动力或奥术机械工具，将锤子直接与凿子结合在一起。它专为凿削更坚硬的石头而制造，这些石头不需要精细技巧即可敲碎成更小的碎块，以便更容易运输。

Jackhammer is a pneumatic, steam-powered, or arcano-mechanical tool that combines a hammer directly with a chisel. It was created specifically to chisel out harder stones that do not require finesse to break into smaller pieces for easier transportation.

Coffin.name: 棺材 Coffin
Coffin.description:
棺材是一种用于在埋葬或火化前展示或存放尸体的殡葬容器。根据不同的文化传统和信仰，它可能会用沉重的铁链加固，或用白银制成，通常耗费巨大，以防御夜行生物。

A coffin is a funerary container used to display or store a corpse before burial or cremation. Depending on cultural traditions and beliefs, it might be reinforced with heavy chains or made of silver, often at great expense, to protect against night creatures.

Wooden Bowl.name: 木碗 Wooden Bowl
Wooden Bowl.description:
木碗由硬木雕刻而成，既美观又实用，以其良好的保温性和易于拿取而闻名。然而，它们的多孔性可能会使清洁和保养更加复杂，因此需要特别护理。

Carved from hardwoods, wooden bowls are both aesthetically pleasing and practical, known for their heat retention and easy handling. Nevertheless, their porous nature can complicate cleaning and maintenance, necessitating special care.

Hexagonite.name: 六角晶石 Hexagonite
Hexagonite.description:
六角石是一种有趣的宝石，其显著特征是在出土时呈六边形形状，这也启发了它的名称。这些宝石常被缝入用于社交活动的服装中，象征性地代表具备结婚资格，尤其是对单身男子而言。

Hexagonite is an interesting gemstone, distinguished by its hexagonal shape when unearthed, which inspired its name. These gems are often sewn into clothing for social events, symbolically representing eligibility for marriage, particularly for bachelors.

Tablàh.name: 塔布拉赫 Tablàh
Tablàh.description:
塔布拉鼓（tablàh），通常被称为高脚杯鼓或圣杯鼓，并且根据地区不同有时也称作 dombek 或 tarabuka，其形状类似一个巨大的高脚杯。由木材制成并覆以薄皮革膜，这种打击乐器在许多音乐传统中扮演着至关重要的角色，为其增添了独特的节奏。

The tablàh, commonly referred to as the goblet drum or chalice drum, and sometimes called dombek or tarabuka depending on the region, has a shape that resembles a large goblet. Made of wood with a thin leather membrane, this percussion instrument plays a vital role in many musical traditions, contributing a unique rhythm to them.

Paradiso.name: 天堂 Paradiso
Paradiso.description:
Paradiso 是一种稀有且独特的花岗岩颜色，只在诸界的少数地点发现。它需求量很高但供应短缺，常常导致地区价格飙升。其浓郁的紫色调赋予它高端外观，使其成为室内家具（如台面和桌子）的精美之选。

Paradiso is a rare and distinct granite color, found only in a few locations throughout the realms. It is in high demand but short supply, often causing regional prices to skyrocket. Its rich purple hue gives it a premium appearance, making it an exquisite choice for indoor furniture such as countertops and tables.

Onion Sprout.name: 洋葱芽 Onion Sprout
Onion Sprout.description:
发芽的洋葱在当年不会长出更多的洋葱。相反，它最终会开花并开始结籽。之后，这些种子可以在下一年长出洋葱。通过将洋葱层内的芽分开并将其种在肥沃的土壤中，你可以在一个生长季内培育出多个新的洋葱。

A sprouting onion won't grow more onions in the current year. Instead, it will eventually flower and begin seeding. Afterward, the seeds can grow onions for the following year. By separating the sprouts inside an onion's layers and planting them in good soil, you can produce multiple new onions within a single season.

Dandelion.name: 蒲公英 Dandelion
Dandelion.description:
蒲公英叶为沙拉、三明治和茶饮增添风味。根部用于某些咖啡替代品中，而花朵则用来酿制葡萄酒。蒲公英无论生吃还是熟吃都绝对安全，而且你几乎可以食用蒲公英的所有部分。它们也可用于药用，因为它们是可用于抗炎酊剂的最佳绿叶之一。

Dandelion leaves add flavor to salads, sandwiches, and teas. The roots are used in some coffee substitutes, and the flowers are used to make wines. Dandelions are definitely safe to eat both raw and cooked, and you can eat almost all parts of the dandelion. They can also be used for medicinal purposes, as they are one of the best greens that can be used in anti-inflammation tinctures.

Natron.name: 天然碱 Natron
Natron.description:
Natron 是一种直接从干涸盐湖湖床中采集的盐类混合物，被炼金术士与草药师广泛用于多种用途。草药师将 Natron 与草药混合，用于治疗轻微的伤口与割伤；而炼金术士则将其作为黏结剂，用于他们所调制的更具腐蚀性或爆炸性的酊剂。

Natron is harvested directly as a salt mixture from dry salt lake beds, and it has multiple applications by both Alchemist and Herbalists. Herbalists mix Natron with herbs to treat minor wounds and cuts, while Alchemists use it as a binding agent for the more corrosive or explosive tinctures they create.

Zircon.name: 锆石 Zircon
Zircon.description:
锆石是一种多种颜色的宝石。它还有一种透明变种，与钻石非常相似，因此通常被用作更便宜的替代品。任何不了解宝石的人都很容易被蒙骗，以为这块石头比实际更昂贵。

Zircon is a gemstone of many colors. There is also a transparent variant of it very similar to a diamond, which is why its usually used as a cheaper alternative to it. Anyone without knowledge of gemstones can be easily fooled into believing that the stone is more expensive than its actually is.

Tuna Fish.name: 金枪鱼 Tuna Fish
Tuna Fish.description:
金枪鱼是一种海水鱼，通常分布在各个界域较温暖的水域中。它在海洋与大海中被广泛捕捞，单条鱼的渔获量常常可达数百磅或更多，使其在许多地区成为一种宝贵的资源。

The tuna is a saltwater fish, commonly found in warmer waters across the realms. It is widely harvested from the seas and oceans, with catches often reaching hundreds of pounds or more per fish, making it a valuable resource in many regions.

Glazed Fruits.name: 蜜饯水果 Glazed Fruits
Glazed Fruits.description:
这种令人愉悦的甜点所选用的水果可能会有所不同，取决于这家面包店常去的早市上有什么可用的水果；在一些罕见的情况下，甚至会使用由魔法变出来的水果。虽然任何新鲜水果都可以使用，但由于更易于烘焙，苹果是最常见的选择。不过，面包师使用其他任何种类的水果也并不罕见，例如橙子、葡萄，甚至野生甜浆果，以增添额外的风味爆发。水果烤好后，面包师会小心地涂上一层由蜂蜜与高品质果酱混合制成的糖衣，或应要求使用价格更高的巧克力；其目标受众从年幼的孩子到嗜甜的成年人不等。

The selection of fruits for this delightful sweet can vary, depending on what's available at the morning market that the bakery frequents, in some rare cases even fruits that were conjured by magic. While any fresh fruit can be used, apples are the most commonly chosen option due to their ease of baking. However, it's not unheard of for bakers to use any other types of fruits, such as oranges, grapes, and even wild sweet berries, to add an extra burst of flavor. After the fruits are baked the baker carefully applies a glaze made from a mixture of honey and high-quality jam, or the higher priced chocolate by request, with the target audience ranging from young children to adults with a sweet tooth.

Honey Cookies.name: 蜂蜜曲奇 Honey Cookies
Honey Cookies.description:
这些用蜂蜜制作的饼干通常口感更松软、味道更甜。由于它们价格实惠、饱腹感强且保质期较长，大多数酒馆都会常备存货，随时出售。

These types of cookies, made with honey, tend to have a fluffier texture and sweeter taste. Due to their affordability, filling nature, and extended shelf life, most taverns keep them in stock for sale at all times.

Bamboula.name: 班布拉 Bamboula
Bamboula.description:
bamboula是一种鼓，由一个朗姆酒桶制成，一端覆以鼓皮；它也与一种同名的传统舞蹈有关。在接纳bamboula的社区中，它的音乐与舞蹈培养出一种异常紧密团结的精神。尽管这种乐器在岛屿国家很常见，但四处旅行的吟游诗人或历史学家在那些地区之外的地方遭遇到它也并不罕见。

The bamboula, a drum made from a rum barrel covered with skin on one end, is also associated with a traditional dance that shares its name. In communities that embrace the bamboula, its music and dance foster an exceptionally close-knit spirit. While the instrument is common in island nations, it's not unusual for traveling bards or historians to encounter it outside those regions.

Green Summer Beetle.name: 绿色夏甲虫 Green Summer Beetle
Green Summer Beetle.description:
绿夏甲虫在生长季节会成为问题，危害花园和作物。这些甲虫以无花果、葡萄和浆果等成熟或发酵的水果为目标。每到夏天，许多平民都会尝试在种植周期中加入苦艾，因为它大多表现为一种驱虫剂。

Green Summer beetles become a problem during the growing season, harming both gardens and crops. These beetles target ripe or fermenting fruits like figs, grapes, and berries. Every summer, many common folk try to include wormwood in their planting cycle as it mostly behaves as an insect repellent.

Aurichalcum Coin.name: 星金硬币 Aurichalcum Coin
Aurichalcum Coin.description:
金铜钱币曾在古代广泛流通。然而，在更近的时代，它们只在偏远地区中发现，那里的主要金属如黄金或白银的许可稀缺，在那里它们的价值与金币相近。

Aurichalcum Coins once saw widespread circulation in ancient times. However, in the more recent era, they are found only in remote regions with scarce access to primary metals such as gold or silver, where they are valued similarly to gold pieces.

Salmon Steak.name: 三文鱼排 Salmon Steak
Salmon Steak.description:
鲑鱼主要产自特定寒冷地区，由于其稀缺性被视为一种稀有且昂贵的餐食。酒馆通常借助神圣或魔法的帮助来保持其新鲜，获取鲑鱼并通常以相当高的溢价出售。

Salmon, primarily sourced from specific cold regions, is considered a rare and pricey meal due to its scarcity. Taverns, often with divine or magical assistance to keep it fresh, obtain salmon and typically sell it at a substantial premium pricing.

Siglos.name: 西格洛斯 Siglos
Siglos.description:
这些钱币完全由修道院为其身为商人的教区居民专门制作。它们通常由石头制成，并以宗教符号与色彩装饰。这些钱币会分发给前往更富裕地区旅行的商人，使他们能够获得许可使用服务，而无需支付额外费用。这些服务可能包括住宿、教育，或与当地大祭司会面。

These coins are crafted exclusively by monasteries for their parishioners who are merchants. They are typically made from stone and decorated with religious symbols and colors. The coins are distributed to merchants who travel to wealthier regions so that they can access services without having to pay extra. These services may include lodging, education, or meetings with the local high priests.

Crow Feathers.name: 乌鸦羽毛 Crow Feathers
Crow Feathers.description:
乌鸦是一种聪明的生物，制作它时，大多数人都说它是守望者与引路者，是一种知晓田野与粪堆双方秘密的生物。据说将它的两根羽毛绑在一起，便能捕捉到那份狡黠的一小缕；而系在其底部的红绳呢？那便充当一个焦点。可以说，它将魔法束缚起来，使其不至于四处游荡。关于这种特定的迷信，人们看法分裂：每一个把它当作幸运符的人旁边，总会有另一个人会往地上啐一口，称其为傻子的赌注。

The crow is a clever creature, when making it, most say it's a watcher and a guide, a creature that knows the secrets of both the field and the midden. Binding two of its feathers is said to capture a small sliver of that cunning, and for the red string tied to its base? That acts as a focus. It binds the magic, so to speak, keeps it from wandering off. This specific suppersticion is divided as for every soul who sees it as a lucky charm, there’s another who’ll spit on the ground and call it a fool’s gamble.

Bench.name: 长凳 Bench
Bench.description:
木质长凳常用于室外露台和繁忙的酒馆，因为它们能够容纳多人就座。通常会成批购入，因为它们因频繁使用而使用寿命有限。

Wooden benches are frequently used in outdoor terraces and busy taverns due to their ability to seat multiple people. Usually purchased in bulk as they have a limited lifespan due to constant use.

White Radish.name: 白萝卜 White Radish
White Radish.description:
它经常因其清澈的白色与雪非常相似而被称为冬季萝卜。白萝卜很适合用于沙拉和凉拌菜，或作为夏日野餐的配菜，也很适合与肉类一起翻炒。

Quite often it is referred to as the winter radish due to its clear white color very similar to snow. The white radish works well in salads and slaws, or as a side dish for summer picnics, and also works well stir-fried with meat.

Copper Slag.name: 铜渣 Copper Slag
Copper Slag.description:
当通过冶炼提取铜时，杂质会以铜渣的形式上浮到表面。这种材料已成为一种永久性的建筑资源，用于道路铺装，并在建筑材料的砂浆中替代砂子。

When copper is extracted through smelting, impurities rise to the surface as copper slag. This material has become a permanent construction resource, used for road pavements and as a replacement for sand in mortar for building materials.

Rutiled Quartz.name: 金红石石英 Rutiled Quartz
Rutiled Quartz.description:
金红石发晶是一种含有宝石内部针状条纹的石英。这些内含物可能随机分布或成束出现，有时会呈星状排列，其分布可稀疏亦可浓密到使石英本体几近不透明。一般而言，内含物往往会降低其他任何晶体的价值，但金红石发晶的价值则取决于这些内含物的品质。

Rutilated quartz is a variety of quartz that contains needle-like strikes within the gem. These inclusions may be distributed randomly or in bundles, which sometimes are arranged star-like, and they can be sparse or dense enough to make the quartz body nearly opaque. While in general inclusions often reduce the value of any other crystal, rutilated quartz is valued for the quality of these inclusions.

Malrite.name: 玛尔赖特 Malrite
Malrite.description:
一颗黑色宝石，无人知晓它是在哪里开采的或如何找到的，因为它只是出现在集市摊位或珠宝店里。当有人向摊主或店主询问它时，他们对它如何出现在自己的库存里毫无头绪。

A black gemstone, no one knows where it is mined or how it is located, as it simply appears at market stalls or jeweler stores. When the owner of the stall or store is inquired about it, they have no clue how it ended up their inventory.

Bone Drinking Glass.name: 饮骨玻璃杯 Bone Drinking Glass
Bone Drinking Glass.description:
一些更古怪的人会想把他们的橱柜装满由骨头制成的盘子、杯子或玻璃杯，或是带有骨质饰物浮雕的器皿。由于生产厨具所需获取的大多数材料的性质，这些物品的交易价值往往非常高。然而，能够把骨头加工成可用物品的工匠并不多，使其稀有度更加显著。

Some of the more eccentric folks look to fill their cupboards with plates, cups, or glasses made out of bone, or with bone paraphernalia embossed on them. Due to the nature of most of the materials procured that are needed to produce kitchenware, they tend to come at a very high trade value. Yet, not a lot of crafters can manipulate bone into usable items, making the rarity even more pronounced.

Favor Coin.name: 偏爱硬币 Favor Coin
Favor Coin.description:
“每个恩惠都有价格”用一种被遗忘的语言蚀刻在金币的一侧。通常由邪恶团体交易并制造，用于地下经济。若需要一项服务，就必须支付一枚硬币。所提供的服务范围可以从一件法衣、先进武器、城堡设计图，到迅速处理尸体不等。所有恩惠，都有价格。

"Each favor has a price” stands etched on the side of the golden coin in a forgotten language. Usually traded and manufactured by nefarious groups for an underground economy. If a service is required, a coin must be paid. The services offered can range from a piece of vestment, advanced weaponry, to castle plans, to the swift disposal of bodies. All favors, all have a price.

Chrysoberyl.name: 金绿宝石 Chrysoberyl
Chrysoberyl.description:
金绿宝石的所有有色透明变种都会被制成宝石，然而，由于它们很难切割，而且价值有限，因此很少被制成首饰。主要在魔法技艺与草药学中作为材料使用。

All colored transparent variants of Chrysoberyl are made into gemstones, however, since they are hard to cut and have a limited value to them and they rarely make it into jewelry. Mainly used in magical arts and herbalism as components.

Zoisite.name: 黝帘石 Zoisite
Zoisite.description:
这种特殊的宝石有多种颜色可供发现，包括绿色、棕色、粉色和黑色。这些宝石特别受过着隐居生活的人们青睐，因为人们相信它们能抵御负面思想与情绪，无论这些是由魔法还是其他方式引起的。据说佩戴时能促进一种平静感。这些宝石在隐士、僧侣以及生活在偏远地区的普通民众中需求很高。

This particular gem can be found in a variety of colors, including green, brown, pink, and black. These gems are particularly favored by people who lead secluded lives, as they are believed to ward off negative thoughts and emotions, whether they are caused by magic or other means. They are said to promote a sense of calm when worn. These gems are in high demand among hermits, monks, and common folk who live in remote areas.

Common Pandora.name: 常见 潘多拉 Common Pandora
Common Pandora.description:
普通红笛鲷，也被称为“鲷鱼之王”或“红潘多拉”，是一种备受推崇的食用鱼。然而，渔船必须深入风高浪急、海况湍急的海域才能捕获它。尽管条件艰难，这种鱼本身相对容易上钩，会迅速咬住鱿鱼、虫类或虾等天然饵料。

Common Pandora, also known as the King of the Breams or Red Pandora, is a highly esteemed food fish. However, fishing boats must venture deep into rough seas and turbulent waters to catch one. Despite the challenging conditions, the fish itself is relatively easy to hook, quickly biting on natural baits such as squid, worms, or shrimp.

Jewelry box.name: 珠宝盒 Jewelry box
Jewelry box.description:
首饰盒对于保护精致的饰品免受伤害至关重要。钻石作为最坚硬的天然材料，既能刮伤更软的宝石（如欧泊和珍珠），也会在较软的金属（如黄金）上留下痕迹。但总体而言，普通的首饰盒在集中式收纳中为首饰提供了专用的空间，从而降低放错位置或丢失的几率。

Jewelry boxes are essential in protecting delicate pieces from damage. While diamonds, being the hardest natural material, can scratch softer gemstones like opals and pearls, they can also mark softer metals like gold. But in general, the regular jewelry boxes provide a dedicated space for jewelry in a centralized storage, reducing the chances of misplacement or loss.

Dragon Heart.name: 龙之心 Dragon Heart
Dragon Heart.description:
龙心是一枚适合皇帝佩戴的坠饰，一件杰作，通常与其对应物——龙之眼耳环——一同出现。这些珠宝由同一种稀有宝石打造，共用“龙心”这一名称。由于该宝石的极端稀有度，只有最著名的宝石切割师和珠宝匠才被允许切割并镶嵌这些宝石。他们的作品将原始的稀有度转化为神祇般力量的象征。

Dragon Heart is a pendant fit for an emperor, a masterpiece typically accompanied by its counterpart, the Dragon's Eyes earrings. The jewelry pieces are crafted from the same rare gemstone sharing the Dragon Heart name. Due to the gem's extreme rarity, only the most famous gem cutters and jewelers are permitted to cut and set these stones. The work made transforms raw rarity into symbols of godlike power.

Shallot.name: 青葱 Shallot
Shallot.description:
红葱头在烹饪中被广泛使用，也可以腌制。将红葱头切成薄片油炸至酥脆，常被用作菜肴的调味配料，尤其常与粥搭配。它们的风味类似洋葱，但口感更温和。与洋葱一样，切开生红葱头会释放刺激眼睛并引起流泪的化合物。一些草药师会采集红葱头来制作敷剂，利用红葱头及其催泪特性。

Shallots are widely used in cooking and can be pickled as well. Thinly sliced and deep-fried shallots are commonly used as a condiment in cuisine, especially with porridge. They offer a flavor akin to onions but with a milder profile. Like onions, cutting raw shallots releases compounds that irritate the eyes and cause tears. Some herbalists collect shallots for making poultices, harnessing the shallots and their tear-inducing qualities.

Glass.name: 玻璃 Glass
Glass.description:
塑形玻璃的过程很耗费时代，而要制作它，吹制玻璃的工匠需要大量的技能。吹制玻璃过程完成且玻璃仍然炽热时，会将其放入模具中，以制作瓶子、小瓶、窗户，以及其他玻璃制品，如花瓶或装饰品。 

The process of shaping glass is time-consuming, and to create it, glassblowers need a vast amount of skill. After the glassblowing process is completed and the glass is still hot, it is placed into molds to create bottles, vials, windows, and other glass objects such as vases or decorative objects.

Cod.name: 鳕鱼 Cod
Cod.description:
鳕鱼的上侧颜色从红褐色到绿灰色不等，腹部呈银色。捕捉鳕鱼的最佳时代是在近海地区它们于早花季节进行季节性迁徙期间，或在叶子变褐的收获季节末尾。鳕鱼几乎会咬食所有类型的鱼饵，包括自制的。

Codfish can vary in color from red-brown to green-gray on its upper sides, with a silver belly. The best time to catch cod is during their seasonal migrations in the early blossoming seasons or at the end of the harvest seasons when the leaves are brown, offshore. Cod are known to bite on nearly all types of bait, including homemade ones.

Barrel.name: 桶 Barrel
Barrel.description:
桶子是最广泛使用的储存容器之一，尤其适用于液体。它们的用途从发酵烈酒到腌制食物或储存自制果汁，使其成为大容量储存的首选。

Barrels are among the most widely used storage containers, especially for liquids. Their uses range from fermenting strong alcohols to preserving pickled foods or storing homemade juices, making them the preferred choice for high-capacity storage.

Redwood Plank.name: 红杉木板 Redwood Plank
Redwood Plank.description:
通常用于制作箱子、桌子、凳子、球棒和桥梁，因此，对于任何具有任何形式建筑背景的人来说，它的需求相当高。

Usually used for creating boxes, tables, stools, bats, and bridges, and due to it, it has quite a high demand for anyone with a background in any form of construction.

Book of Fables.name: 寓言之书 Book of Fables
Book of Fables.description:
由多位作者撰写的一系列奇幻故事。年轻读者将其中一些故事视为心头所爱，尤其是以动物为中心的故事，其中一则讲述了一只兔子和一只乌龟，另一则讲述了一只狐狸试图触及一些葡萄。

A series of fantastical stories written by multiple authors. Young readers hold a few of these tales dear to their hearts, particularly the animal-centered ones, one which follows a rabbit and a turtle and another tells of a fox trying to reach some grapes.

Sickle.name: Sickle
Sickle.description:
镰刀作为最常见的手工工具之一，被广泛用于收割作物、割草，并协助从田地里采集蔬菜。其刀刃的多功能性还体现在于某些地区作为武器发挥重要作用。

The sickle being one of the most common hand tools, finds extensive use in harvesting crops, cutting grass, and assisting in the gathering of vegetables from fields. The versatility of its blade extends to having a major role as a weapon in certain regions.

Dungeon Plans.name: 地城平面图 Dungeon Plans
Dungeon Plans.description:
一张地城平面示意图包含某个特定地城的完整布局，无论该地城已建成，还是计划建造在城堡、要塞或大型住宅（如庄园）之下。地城通常用于在审判前关押囚犯。虽然地城本身并非为长期监禁而设，但囚犯在其中被关押较长时间也并非闻所未闻。该示意图通常还包括专门用于审讯、证物储存或其他与统治当局需求相关用途的区域。

A dungeon plan schematic contains the full layout of a specific dungeon, either already built or planned to be constructed beneath a castle, fort, or large dwelling, such as a manor. Dungeons are typically used to hold prisoners until a trial. While the dungeon itself is not intended for long-term confinement, it is not unheard of for prisoners to remain there for extended periods. The schematic often includes areas specifically designed for interrogation, storage of evidence, or other purposes tied to the ruling authority’s needs.

Pocketwatch.name: 怀表 Pocketwatch
Pocketwatch.description:
这种怀表有两种不同类型。猎人式怀表是带有弹簧铰链的圆形金属盖或掩蔽的表壳，可盖在表盘上方，保护其免受灰尘、刮擦以及其他伤害或碎屑的影响；而开面式怀表则是表壳缺少金属掩蔽来保护正面的玻璃。

The pocket watches come in two different types. A hunter-case pocket watch is a case with a spring-hinged circular metal lid or cover, that closes over the watch-dial, protecting them from dust, scratches and other damage or debris while an open-faced is one in which the case lacks a metal cover to protect the front glass.

Breadseed Poppy.name: 面包籽罂粟 Breadseed Poppy
Breadseed Poppy.description:
罂粟是一种常见于花园中的观赏植物。人们种植它以获取其种子、油和药用特性。与烈酒混合时，它可以作为强效止痛剂使用。

The breadseed poppy is a decorative plant often found in gardens. It is grown for its seeds, oil, and medicinal properties. When combined with strong alcohol, it can be used as a powerful pain reliever.

Death Cap.name: 死亡帽 Death Cap
Death Cap.description:
最不受欢迎的人最偏爱的蘑菇。食用毒鹅膏通常会致命。在大多数靠近文明的森林里，人们会竖起告示牌，警告人们不要随意食用野生蘑菇，因为毒鹅膏几乎到处都能生长。 

The most favored mushroom by the most unfavorable people. The consumption of the Death Cap is more often than not fatal. In most forests close to civilization, signs are put up to warn people against eating random mushrooms due to the Death Caps growing almost anywhere.

Wool.name: 羊毛 Wool
Wool.description:
一种从农场动物（主要是绵羊）身上获得的纺织织物，主要用于制作服装。除此之外，它也用于制作毯子、骑兵用马鞍垫布、地毯，并且在极少数情况下甚至用作土壤肥料。

A textile fabric that is obtained from farm animals, mainly sheep, and is primarily used for clothing. In addition to that, it is also used for blankets, saddle cloths for cavalry, carpeting, and on rare occasions even a soil fertilizer.

Augelite.name: 奥吉莱石 Augelite
Augelite.description:
奥格莱特是一种遍布诸界的装饰性石材。它主要由祭司佩戴，并被镶嵌在珠宝与圣徽之中。据称这种宝石能够反射任何魔法，或在少数情况下被用来制造小型反魔法力场。平民宣称奥格莱特宝石具备吸收负能量的能力，而人们普遍相信这就是它被镶嵌在宗教物品中的原因。

Augelite is an ornamental stone found throughout the realms. It is mainly worn by priests and is embedded into jewelry and holy symbols. This gemstone is stated to reflect any magic, or it is rarely used to create small anti-magic fields. Commoners claim that augelite gemstone has the ability to absorb negative energy and its widely believed that this is the reason is embedded in religious items.

Cinnamon.name: 肉桂 Cinnamon
Cinnamon.description:
从多种树木的内层树皮中获取的肉桂，被广泛用作芳香的调味品和增味添加剂，应用于许多菜系中。它能提升甜味与咸味菜肴、百吉饼、茶、热巧克力以及传统食物的风味。

Obtained from the inner bark of several trees, cinnamon is widely used as an aromatic condiment and flavoring additive in many cuisines. It enhances the taste of sweet and savory dishes, bagels, teas, hot chocolate, and traditional foods.

Mine Rails.name: 矿井铁轨 Mine Rails
Mine Rails.description:
由钢制成，以承受运载矿石和岩石的推车带来的沉重负载。铁匠在打造这些时，被要求使用他们库存中最为完好的材料，以确保它们经得起时代的考验，并且不会在极端压力和温度下弯曲。

Made out of steel to sustain the heavy loads from carts carrying ore and rocks. Blacksmiths, when crafting these, are required to use the most pristine materials they have in stock to ensure they stand the test of time and do not bend under extreme pressures and temperatures.

Hazelnut.name: 榛子 Hazelnut
Hazelnut.description:
榛子因其颜色——榛色——而得名。有时它们也被称为榛果或榛实。这些坚果可用于蛋糕或作为酥粒配料，不过，如果磨碎，它们也可以用作烘焙用的面粉。 

Hazelnuts get their name from their color, hazel. Sometimes they are also referred to as cobnuts or filberts. The nuts are used in cakes or as crumble toppings, however, if grounded they can also be used as flour for baking.

Calico Bass.name: 花斑鲈 Calico Bass
Calico Bass.description:
加利科鲈鱼，常被称为海带鲈鱼或公牛鲈鱼，是一种容易捕获的鱼，会被蠕虫、小鱼苗或浮游生物等小饵料引诱。由于在烹饪中用途广泛，它非常适合制作许多菜肴。不过，人们最常以烧烤的方式享用它，或将其包在风味十足的塔可中。

Calico Bass, often called kelp bass or bull bass, is an easily caught fish, lured in by small bait like worms, minnows, or plankton. With many uses in cooking, it is great for many dishes. Still, it is most frequently enjoyed grilled or wrapped in flavorful tacos.

Ruined Pelt.name: 破损的毛皮 Ruined Pelt
Ruined Pelt.description:
不熟练的皮匠的作品。这些通常来自用于培训新雇员的练习皮革，或是真正的失误。它们通常用途有限，但在大多数情况下，最终会变成皮革条、鞋带或绳子，并且很少被添加到器具上。

The unskilled leatherworkers' handiworks. These are usually from either training pelts to train new hires or an actual mistake. They usually have limited uses, but in most scenarios, they end up as either leather strips, shoelaces, or rope, and are rarely added to an implement.

Pressure Gauge.name: 压力计 Pressure Gauge
Pressure Gauge.description:
压力表是一种测量仪器，用于监测密闭系统内的力，例如蒸汽管道或炼金装置。一些变体专注于奥术机制，使用附魔液体或元素灵体来侦测肉眼无法察觉的力的波动。

An pressure gauge is a measuring instrument used to monitor the force within contained systems, such as steam conduits or alchemical apparatus. Some variants are focused on arcane mechanisms, using enchanted fluids or elemental spirits to detect fluctuations in force that would be invisible to the naked eye.

Moldavite.name: 陨石玻璃 Moldavite
Moldavite.description:
绿陨石是最引人入胜的宝石之一。据说这种宝石很久以前从一块巨大的岩石中自天空坠落而来，然而并没有关于这一特定事件的记录被制作出来或历经岁月保存至今以供证实。

Moldavite is one of the most intriguing gems. It is said that this gem came from the skies long ago from a gigantic rock, yet no records of this specific event were made or survived the ages to confirm.

Silver Pearl.name: 银珍珠 Silver Pearl
Silver Pearl.description:
即使它被称为银，它通常也会根据其采集的生物群系而带有绿色色调。主要供炼金术师用来制作药剂，以提升使用者的专注力与生存技能。

Even if it's referred to as silver, it usually bears a green tint based on the biome it was harvested from. Mainly used by alchemists to create potions that improve the user's attention and survival skills.

Transport Shackles.name: 运输至镣铐群岛 Transport Shackles
Transport Shackles.description:
这些镣铐由铁或钢制成，与其同类一样，旨在便于大规模生产，其功能类似于枷锁。它们通常被设计为将数副镣铐串成一条链，以便在不同地点之间转运囚犯。

These shackles, made from iron or steel, like their counterparts and intended for easy mass production, function similar to pillories. They are typically designed to link several sets of shackles in a daisy chain to facilitate the transport of prisoners between locations.

Bronze Gunmetal.name: 青铜枪金属 Bronze Gunmetal
Bronze Gunmetal.description:
青铜炮金属是由铜、锡和锌组成的合金，并含有少量其他金属，如铅或镍。它主要用于铸造大炮、火器和各种军事装备，但也用于配件、齿轮、轴承、雕像以及纽扣等小物件。

Bronze Gunmetal is an alloy of copper, tin, and zinc, with trace amounts of other metals such as lead or nickel, found its primary use in casting cannons, firearms, and various military equipment but also in fittings, gears, bearings, statues, and small objects such as buttons.

Onion.name: 洋葱 Onion
Onion.description:
洋葱在世界各地被种植和使用。作为食物物品，它们通常会作为已烹制的咸味菜肴的一部分熟食上桌，但也可以生吃，或用于制作腌菜或酸辣酱。切碎时气味辛辣，某些类型的洋葱可能会刺激眼睛。

Onions are cultivated and used around the world. As a food item, they are usually served cooked as part of a prepared savory dish, but can also be eaten raw or used to make pickles or chutneys. They are pungent when chopped and some types of onion may irritate the eyes.

Rosaline.name: 罗莎琳 Rosaline
Rosaline.description:
Rosaline，也被称为粉红黝帘石，是一种以其能够呈现三种不同颜色而闻名的宝石：紫色、红色，以及根据观察角度不同呈现的蓝色或绿色。被碾碎后，Rosaline 可用于制作染发剂或颜料染料，产生一种可爱的粉红偏红色调。

Rosaline, also referred to as pink zoisite, is a gemstone known for its ability to exhibit three distinct colors, purple, red, and either blue or green, depending on the viewing angle. When crushed, Rosaline is used to create hair or paint dye, producing a lovely pink-red hue.

Tanzanite.name: 坦桑石 Tanzanite
Tanzanite.description:
坦桑石宝石是一种黝帘石，以其深蓝色和独特的光学特性而闻名。它是少数几种能根据观察角度显示三种不同颜色的宝石之一。坦桑石从一个方向观察时呈现出鲜明的蓝色，而从其他角度观察时则会变为从紫罗兰色到红色的色调。

The Tanzanite gemstone, a type of zoisite, is known for its deep blue color and unique optical properties. It is one of the few gemstones that can display three different colors depending on the viewing angle. Tanzanite appears as a distinct blue when viewed from one direction and shifts to hues ranging from violet to red when viewed from other angles.

Spirit Lights.name: 灵魂之光 Spirit Lights
Spirit Lights.description:
唉，这下可好，是灵光，这是我一点也不想遇到的遭遇。我在旅途中见过它们两次，如果你问我，那就已经多得离谱了。它们起初看起来无害，是些在暮色中飘荡的小小闪烁，不比萤火虫大。但收获季的老手们更清楚。那些光并不会全年飞来飞去。它们只会在红色收获期间现身——当月亮排成一线，田野在它们的光芒下泛起猩红。你若在垄间追着其中一盏待得太久，就会有什么东西跟上来。我听过夜里的尖叫声，细薄而遥远。

Well now's the Spirit Lights, and encounter that I don't wish. I’ve seen them twice in my travels, and that’s twice too many if you ask me. They look harmless at first, little flickers drifting through the dusk, not larger than fireflies. But the veterans of the harvest know better. Those lights don’t flit about all year. They only show themselves during the Red Harvest, when the moons line up and the fields glow crimson under their light. Stay out in the rows too long chasing one, and something follows. I’ve heard the screams in the night, thin and distant.

On the Making of New Potions - A Newbie.name: 论新药水的制作——新手炼金术士的药水酿制指南 On the Making of New Potions - A Newbie Alchemist Guide to Potion brewing
On the Making of New Potions - A Newbie.description:
一本初学炼金术士的书，里面充满了关于如何调制药水的详细说明，并在最后几页收录了少量配方。它解释了根据需要蒸馏的内容应选择哪些蒸馏器更为合适，并指出哪些常见原料最适合作为药水的基底。本书的结构旨在循序渐进地培养读者的技能，从简单混合物开始，逐步过渡到更复杂的调制技术。

A beginner alchemist’s book, filled with detailed instructions on how to brew potions and including a few recipes on the last pages. It explains which alembics are preferable depending on what needs to be distilled and identifies common ingredients that work best as potion bases. The book is structured to gradually build the reader's skills, starting with simple mixtures and moving toward more complex brewing techniques.

Brocade.name: 织锦 Brocade
Brocade.description:
贵族的生活充满了娱乐、骑乘、狩猎、音乐与舞蹈，所有这些活动都是展示时尚的阶段。富有的贵族穿着锦缎类服装，它们由多色丝绸制成，有时甚至镶织金银线，以彰显财富。

The life of a noble is filled with entertainment, riding, hunting, music, and dancing, all of these activities are a stage for the display of fashion. Wealthy nobles wear brocade-type clothing, they are made with multi-colored silks and sometimes even embedded with gold and silver threads, as a display of wealth.

Tulip.name: 郁金香 Tulip
Tulip.description:
郁金香曾因其醒目的外观、受欢迎程度以及有限的供应而引发了一场重大的经济危机，被称为“郁金香狂热”。由于它们需要特定的气候和收获周期，它们成为了奢侈品。在泡沫破裂之后，郁金香最终以更合理的价格变得触手可及，人人皆可获得，甚至每个平民也能拥有。

Tulips once triggered a major economic crisis, known as "tulip mania," because of their striking appearance, popularity, and limited availability. Since they required a specific climate and harvest cycle, they became luxury goods. After the bubble burst, tulips eventually became accessible at a more reasonable price, accessible to every commoner.

Euclase.name: 蓝柱石 Euclase
Euclase.description:
硅铍石很容易被切割成刻面宝石，颜色多样，从无色到淡黄色、明黄色、淡绿色以及蓝色不等。其中蓝色的色调拥有最高的价格。有人推测这种特定的宝石对任何形式的奥术技艺都反应不佳，因为当它与之相互作用时，会爆炸成一个由玻璃与弹片构成的小球。

Euclase was easily cut into faceted gems and came in various colors ranging from colorless to pale yellow, vivid yellow, pale green, and blue. The blue hues commanded the highest price. There's speculation that this specific gem is not reacting well to any form of arcane arts, as when it interacts with them, it explodes into a small ball of glass and shrapnel.

Tanners’ Bolt.name: 制革匠之矢 Tanners’ Bolt
Tanners’ Bolt.description:
“鞣革工坊的布卷”确实指的是鞣革厂产出的成品。将兽皮鞣制成皮革涉及一个会永久改变皮肤的过程，使其更耐用，并且不易因年代而分解或变色。成品以巨大的掷骰状形式出现，包含数层皮革，简称为一卷（bolt）。

Tanners' Bolt does refer to the end product that comes from a tannery. Tanning hide into leather involves a process that permanently alters the skin, making it more durable and less susceptible to decomposition and coloring due to age. The end product comes in a huge roll with several layers of leather, simply called a bolt.

Bismuth Bronze.name: 铋青铜 Bismuth Bronze
Bismuth Bronze.description:
铋青铜或铋黄铜是一种铜合金，主要用于制造耐腐蚀的螺栓、钉子以及各种其他金属部件。其独特的性质使其成为海洋环境中的首选。

Bismuth Bronze or Bismuth Brass is a copper alloy primarily used for manufacturing corrosion-resistant bolts, nails, and various other metal components. Its unique properties make it a favored choice for marine environments.

Tiretaine.name: 提雷泰恩 Tiretaine
Tiretaine.description:
提莱坦布由羊毛和其他织物混合制成，主要用于制作毛巾、抹布和平民连衣裙，因为它制造成本低且易于大规模生产。

The Tiretaine cloth is made with a mix of wool and other fabrics, mainly used to create towels, rags, and commoner dresses, as it is cheap to manufacture and easy to mass produce.

Marriage Band.name: 婚戒 Marriage Band
Marriage Band.description:
通常由黄金制成，它通常是一个宗教象征，表示在神祇的见证下将两人结合在一起。戒指本身可以用多种方式制作，可以添加宝石、铭文，甚至在极少数有人对黄金或白银过敏的情况下使用替代材料。

Usually made out of gold, it is usually a religious symbol of bonding two in the eyes of a deity. The ring itself can be manufactured in multiple ways, with the addition of gems, inscriptions, or even alternative materials in the rare case that someone is allergic to gold or silver.

Smithsonite.name: 菱锌矿 Smithsonite
Smithsonite.description:
菱锌矿，也被称为锌石英，常在锌矿矿床中被发现。在更早的年代，人们相信它拥有使盲者重见光明的非凡能力，尽管实现这一壮举的古老方法已湮没于无名之中。现代炼金术士仍在持续探索，试图揭示并复兴这些失落的技艺。

Smithsonite, also referred to as zinc spar, is frequently discovered in zinc ore deposits. In earlier eras, it was believed to possess the remarkable ability to restore sight to the blind, though the ancient methods for achieving this feat have faded into obscurity. Modern alchemists persist in their quest to uncover and revive these lost arts.

Eggs and Sausage.name: 鸡蛋和香肠 Eggs and Sausage
Eggs and Sausage.description:
一份简单却丰盛的早餐，适合所有平民，这道菜让一天有个好开始。它可以配一份豆子作配菜，或者对那些更喜欢清淡餐食的人来说，搭配他们的晨间咖啡。

A simple yet hearty breakfast for all commoners, this dish gets the day going. It can be served with a side of beans, or for those who prefer a lighter meal, with their morning coffee.

Antimony.name: 锑 Antimony
Antimony.description:
锑是一种相当脆的金属。大多数与闪电调谐的魔法使用者将其用作导体，作为引导其法术中奔涌的未驯能量的媒介。炼金术士将锑研磨成细粉以扑灭火焰，无论是魔法的还是其他的。极少数情况下，粉末形态会用于颜料之中，因其独特、夺目的闪光而备受珍视。

Antimony is quite a bit of a brittle metal. Most lightning-attuned magical users use it as a conductor, a guide for untamed energy coursing through their spells. Alchemists grind antimony into a fine powder to extinguish fires, magical or otherwise. Rarely, the powdered form is used in pigments, valued for its distinctive, eye-catching sparkle.

Where to Find Veins - A Prospector's Gui.name: 在哪里寻找矿脉——探矿者的寻矿指南 Where to Find Veins - A Prospector's Guide to Ore Finding
Where to Find Veins - A Prospector's Gui.description:
关于矿物多样性以及它们如何从周围环境吸收特性的详细指南。本书提供大量信息，说明一旦在洞穴或矿井系统中发现矿物，如何根据颜色快速识别它们。内容包括诸如赤铁矿虽被视为较低等宝石，但可加工以提取铁矿石，以及铝土矿也可类似精炼以产出铝等细节。矿工、炼金术士与工匠也同样研读此指南，以深化对珍贵矿物资源及其实际用途与成分的理解。

Detailed guide on the versatility of minerals and how they absorb properties from their surroundings. The book provides extensive information on how to quickly identify minerals by color once found in a cave or mine system. It includes details such as how hematite, while considered a lesser gem, can be processed to extract iron ore, and how bauxite can similarly be refined to produce aluminum. Miners, alchemists, and artisans alike also review this guide to refine their understanding of valuable mineral resources and their practical applications and composition.

Dioptase.name: 透辉石 Dioptase
Dioptase.description:
硅孔雀石深受宝石收藏家喜爱，有时会被加工成用于珠宝的小型宝石。这种宝石的另一种用途是也可以被研磨成粉，用作绘画颜料。

Dioptase is greatly favored by gem collectors and is sometimes fashioned into small gems for jewelry. Another use for the gemstone is that it can also be pulverized and used as a pigment for painting.

Belajurite.name: 贝拉朱瑞特石 Belajurite
Belajurite.description:
这种宝石早已湮没于历史之中，仅在少数被发现的标本中为人所知。如今无人知晓它的确切外观。古代卷轴中的描述表明，它是一种深海水般的绿色宝石，表面光滑，所有已知标本的体型大约与人类的拳头相当。

Lost to history, this gem is known from only a handful of discovered specimens. No one alive knows its exact appearance. Descriptions from ancient scrolls suggest it was a deep seawater green gem with a smooth surface, and all known specimens were approximately the size of a human fist.

Beer.name: 啤酒 Beer
Beer.description:
大多数酒馆、酒吧和修道院都会酿造自己的啤酒以满足当地需求。由于啤酒可以以低成本大量生产，它始终为这些场所带来稳定的利润。

Most taverns, pubs, and monasteries brew their own beers to meet local demand. Since beer is inexpensive to produce in large quantities, it consistently provides a steady profit for these establishments.

Hyalite.name: 海蓝石 Hyalite
Hyalite.description:
乳白石，一种乳白色的石英，主要用于制作水晶球。它尤其受到奥术艺术与神秘学科的新手修习者青睐，促使各学院大量采购乳白石。

Hyalite, a milky form of quartz, is mainly utilized for crafting crystal balls. It is particularly favored by novice practitioners of arcane arts and mystical disciplines, leading schools to procure hyalite in large quantities.

Bear Hide.name: 熊皮 Bear Hide
Bear Hide.description:
为简化起见通常被概括为熊皮，但它通常不止包含四足生物的常规部分，且通常按体型来称呼。有些传闻提到一种更为古怪的皮毛，与某些人称之为神话动物的存在有关；而另一些人则赌上性命发誓它是真实存在的，那种皮毛里填满了猫头鹰的羽毛。

While generalized as a bear hide for simplicity, it usually includes more than just the regular for a legged creature, it is usually referred to by size. Some rumors mention one that is a bit on the weirder territory, a pelt associated with what some call a mythical animal, while others swear on their life it is real, that is filled with owl feathers.

Sweet Bread.name: 甜面包 Sweet Bread
Sweet Bread.description:
甜面包的味道和外观会因地区而有显著差异。一些地区选择可可，而另一些则偏好以水果为基础的配方。然而，无论点的是哪一种具体类型，无论是在酒馆还是面包店，甜面包都是宗教庆典或活动的热门选择，也深受嗜甜者喜爱。

Sweet bread varies significantly in taste and appearance depending on the region. Some regions opt for cocoa, while others prefer fruit-based recipes. However, regardless of the specific type ordered, whether in taverns or bakeries, sweet bread is a popular choice for religious celebrations or events, as well as for those with a sweet tooth.

Caltabose.name: 蒺藜毒菇 Caltabose
Caltabose.description:
Caltabose 香肠主要由猪肉制成，但与普通香肠不同，它使用多种猪肉部位，包括肝、肾、五花肉、猪皮和脾脏，并搭配米饭、洋葱和香料。

The Caltabose sausage is primarily made of pork meat, but unlike regular sausages, it uses multiple types of pork cuts, including liver, kidney, pork belly, rind, and spleen, along with rice, onions, and spices.

Aphid.name: 蚜虫 Aphid
Aphid.description:
蚜虫是一种微小的昆虫，靠从植物中吸食汁液为生。它们的出现会导致严重的作物伤害，而如果不加以干预，它们会对农场、树木和花园造成威胁。平民害怕这些小家伙的任何出现。

Aphids are tiny insects that survive by sucking sap from plants. Their presence can lead to serious crop damage, and without intervention, they pose a threat to farms, trees, and gardens alike. Commoners dread any appearance of this little critters.

Peach.name: 桃子 Peach
Peach.description:
桃子被广泛鲜食，也常被烘焙成派和果馅酥饼。到了冬季，它们会浸在加了糖和蜂蜜的水中储存，或在较暖的季节作为点心供应。

Peaches are widely eaten fresh and are also baked in pies and cobblers. For the winter they are stored in water with sugar and honey or provided as refreshments for the warmer seasons.

Sunberry.name: 阳莓 Sunberry
Sunberry.description:
或者奇迹果有时也被称为茄属植物。过去，也曾有传言称有一种生物也共享“茄属植物”这一名称。这些植物属于普遍类型，茄子和番茄是同一茄科家族的一部分，烟草以及颠茄植物也同样如此。然而，当草药师提到茄属植物时，他们主要指一种称为日浆果的特定类型。平民常将其用于家庭偏方。

Or Wonderberries sometimes referred to as Nightshade. In the past, there had been rumors of a creature sharing the Nightshade name as well. These plants are of a universal type, Eggplants and Tomatoes are part of the same family of nightshade, as well as Tabacco and the Belladonna plant. However, when herbalists refer to Nightshade they mainly refer to a specific type called Sunberries. It is used in home remedies by the common folk.

Linen.name: 亚麻 Linen
Linen.description:
一种非常坚固且吸水性强的材料，在炎热的天气中穿着非常舒适，并被广泛用于纺织品。

A very strong and absorbent material, that is very comfortable to wear in hot weather and is widely used in textiles.

Runner Peanut.name: 奔跑者花生 Runner Peanut
Runner Peanut.description:
花生可用于制作花生油、花生酱、烤花生、咸甜花生棒和花生酱汁，也可以生吃或加盐食用。

Peanuts are useful in the making of peanut oil, peanut butter, roasted peanuts, salted and sweet peanut bars, and peanut sauce but they can also be eaten raw or salted.

Carnation.name: 康乃馨 Carnation
Carnation.description:
通常被称为康乃馨或石竹粉，除了它们的观赏性相之外，大多数房屋里都有一盆盆栽花。康乃馨在与蜂蜜调成糊状后，被一些草药师用来治疗诸如皮肤问题、脱发和肌肉紧张等问题。

Commonly known as Carnation or Clove Pink, and besides the ornamental aspect of them, where most houses have a potted flower. The Carnations, after turning in a paste with honey, are used by some herbalists to treat issues such as skin problems, hair loss, and muscle tension.

Pollucite.name: 方柱石 Pollucite
Pollucite.description:
铯榴石通常是一种透明、易碎的白色石头。在某些地区，它会被碾碎并与葡萄酒混合后饮用，被认为能带来非凡的好运。尽管有传统信仰，治疗师和草药师警告说，它往往会引起严重的胃痛。

Pollucite is usually a transparent, brittle white stone. In certain regions, it is crushed and mixed with wine for consumption, believed to bring exceptional good fortune. Despite traditional beliefs, healers and herbalists warn that it often causes severe stomach pain.

Hardtack.name: 硬饼干 Hardtack
Hardtack.description:
硬饼干由面粉、水和盐制成，以其超长的保质期而闻名。由于其价格低廉且经久耐放，它在漫长的海上航行和军事远征期间充当主要口粮，在那些情况下大多数其他食物都十分稀缺。

Hardtack, made from flour, water, and salt, is known for its long shelf life. Due to its affordability and durability, it serves as a staple sustenance during long sea voyages and military campaigns, where most other foods are scarce.

Diopside.name: 透辉石 Diopside
Diopside.description:
这种石头有白色、绿色或黄色的色调可供选择，常常混在一起。对于发现它的人来说，它被称为“幸运之石”；它被公认为因卓越军事功绩而授予的“功勋之石”；在德鲁伊圈子中，它被尊为“大地母亲之石”，被认为会为土地赐予祝福。

This stone is available in white, green, or yellow hues, often mixed together. It is dubbed "The Fortune Stone" for those who discover it, recognized as the "Stone of Service" awarded for outstanding military achievements, and revered as the "Stone of Mother Earth" among Druidic circles, believed to bestow blessings upon the land.

Alexandrite.name: 紫翠玉 Alexandrite
Alexandrite.description:
人们相信，如果这颗透明宝石的持有者做出有利的动作或保护他的家人，他就会被这颗宝石赐予好运。在某些地区，这颗宝石被视为神圣之物，并被作为祭品献给神祇，或用于祝圣场所。

It is believed that, if the owner of this transparent gem performs favorable actions or protects his family, he is bestowed with good luck by the gemstone. In some regions, the gemstone is considered sacred and provided as a sacrifice to deities or used to consecrate sites.

Red Topaz.name: 红色黄玉 Red Topaz
Red Topaz.description:
也被称为风信子石、火焰宝石，或有时称为刚玉，它是魔法制作中最常用的宝石之一。由于其用途非常特殊，其价格可能在很大范围内波动。除魔法用途之外，它是仅次于钻石的最耐久矿物之一。玻璃工使用它作为更便宜的替代品来制作玻璃切割器。

Also referred to as Jacinth, Flamegem, or sometimes Corundum it is one of the most common gems used in magical crafting. Due to its very specific use, its price can range widely. Outside of magical use it is one of the most durable minerals after the Diamond. Gaffers use it as a cheaper alternative to create glass cutters.

Purple Pink Diamond.name: 紫粉钻石 Purple Pink Diamond
Purple Pink Diamond.description:
有时也被称为花式钻石，它们极其稀有。也有人推测，佩戴特定钻石的人可以免受某些法术或惑控效果的影响。 

Sometimes also referred to as fancy diamonds, they are extremely rare. It is also speculated that the wearers of specific diamonds can be protected from some spells or enchantments.

Tabasheer.name: 塔巴谢尔 Tabasheer
Tabasheer.description:
竹石是一种类似蛋白石的石头，产自特定竹子的节间。此石不用于装饰，但被草药师视为药用珍品，可用于治疗诸如发热、创伤或无法控制的呕吐等症状，无论其成因是否源自奥术力量。

Tabasheer is an opal-like type of stone found in the nodes of specific bamboo. This stone is not used for ornamentation but is valued by herbalists for medicinal purposes, aiding in the treatment of symptoms such as fevers, wounds, or uncontrollable vomiting, whether caused by arcane sources or otherwise.

Zinc.name: 锌 Zinc
Zinc.description:
锌是一种稀有、闪耀的金属，以其抵御自然元素的能力而闻名。它呈柔和的银色，在光线下闪烁。它常被用来为其他金属（如铁或钢）镀覆，以保护它们免受锈蚀和腐坏。在古代，人们认为它具有魔法特性，并用于制作强大的护符和护身符，甚至魔法镜子。

Zinc is a rare, shimmering metal that is known for its ability to protect against the elements. It has a soft, silver color that glimmers in the light.  It is often used to coat other metals, such as iron or steel, to protect them from rust and decay. In ancient times, it was believed to have magical properties and was used in the crafting of powerful talismans and amulets, even magical mirrors.

Walnut.name: 核桃 Walnut
Walnut.description:
采自核桃树，它们可用于多种食谱以增添风味。例如：撒在沙拉上、加入酱汁中、制作成脱水水果、添加到烘焙食品上，以及更多其他烹饪用途，但也可以生吃。

Harvested from the walnut tree, they can be used in several recipes for an added taste. Such as Sprinkled on salads, added to sauces, created dehydrated fruits, added on bakery products, and many more other culinary uses but it also can be eaten raw.

Titanium.name: 钛 Titanium
Titanium.description:
钛是一种令人难以置信的金属。它非常昂贵且稀有，但它也具有一些惊人的强化特性，使其成为现存最坚固的金属之一！当由王国各地最著名的铁匠将这种珍贵的银灰色金属锻造成武器和护甲时，据说它几乎坚不可摧，更不用说它还异常轻盈却比钢更坚固，使其成为制作武器和护甲的完美材料。

Titanium is an incredible metal. It is really expensive and rare, but it also has some amazing strengthening properties that make it one of the strongest metals around! When forged into weapons and armor by the most famous blacksmiths throughout the realm, this precious silver-gray metal is said to be near indestructible, not to mention incredibly light yet stronger than steel, making it the perfect material for crafting weapons and armor.

Fan.name: 扇子 Fan
Fan.description:
主要由纸制成，或罕见地由布制成，并以轻金属（如锡）或轻木（如红杉）加固。扇子上有精巧的图案，许多被制作成反映地域象征或家族徽记。有些扇子以鲜艳的色彩或精致的刺绣装饰，被视为身份象征，并作为传家宝珍藏。在一个酷热难耐的夏日，村民们手腕一抖便展开扇子，布与木交织成一场同步的舞蹈，扇起一阵轻柔的微风，带来片刻的清凉，缓解太阳无情的热力。

Primarily made out of paper, or rarely from cloth, and reinforced with either light metals, such as tin, or light woods, like redwood. The fans feature intricate designs, with many crafted to reflect regional symbols or family crests. Some fans, adorned with vibrant colors or delicate embroidery, are considered status symbols and are cherished as heirlooms. On a blistering summer day, villagers unfold their fans with a flick of the wrist, a synchronized dance of fabric and wood, creating a gentle breeze that brings momentary relief from the sun's relentless heat.

Bone Dice.name: 骨骰 Bone Dice
Bone Dice.description:
由大多数生物的骨头制成，主要是动物的踝骨或类似部位，不过也会使用蹄、角，甚至鹿角。过去这些骰子并不用来玩游戏，而是宗教人士与石头、木棍，甚至动物内脏一起用于占卜。在一些更偏远的地区，掷骰子可能是一种侮辱，因此不建议这样做。

Made from most creatures, mainly ankle bones from animals or otherwise, however, hooves, horns, and even antlers were also used. In the past the dice were not used for games, were used by religious figures with rocks, sticks, or even animal entrails, for fortune-telling. In some of the more remote regions playing dice might be an insult and is advisable against it.

Dark Rose.name: 暗玫瑰 Dark Rose
Dark Rose.description:
你不会在任何像样的花园里发现它被采收并精心照料——谢天谢地。我只在古老而被遗忘的战场那灰烬般的土壤里，或在寂静、阴暗而浓密的森林中见过它；在那里，连空气都让人觉得潮湿、陈旧且带着警觉。它的茎与叶呈深紫色，如同一天前的瘀伤，叶脉浸着深到近乎发黑的猩红；而花朵本身，颜色的确酷似鲜血。它没有香气，取而代之的是一种金属般的气味，像随风而来的恐惧，以及被遗忘之物那忧郁的腐朽。

You won't find this harvested and cared for in any proper garden, and thank the stars for that. I had only ever seen it in ashy soil of old forgotten battlefields or in the silent, dark and thick forests where the very air feels damp, old and watchful. Its stems and leaves are the deep purple of a day old bruise, veined with a crimson so dark it’s nearly black, while the flower itself, does resemble blood in color. It has no scent, instead, it carries a metallic smell, like dread on the wind, and the melancholy decay of the forgotten.

Hambergite.name: 汉堡石 Hambergite
Hambergite.description:
汉堡石通常无色或呈淡蓝色。尽管被归类为半宝石，但它更因其在照明方面的用途而受到重视。它常被用于灯具中，以增强蜡烛和其他光源的亮度，无论这些光源是传统的还是通过奥术手段产生的。

Hambergite is typically colorless or faintly blue. Despite being categorized as a semi-precious gem, it is more valued for its applications in lighting. It is commonly used in lamps to enhance the brightness of candles and other light sources, whether they are conventional or by arcane means.

Blue Sapphire.name: 蓝宝石 Blue Sapphire
Blue Sapphire.description:
深蓝色且透明度极佳的优质蓝宝石，每颗可达数百钱币。一种在涉及影响心智的魔法法术中最常用的物品之一。在某些地区，它被用于制造像魔像这样的魔法机械构装体。 

Fine-colored Sapphire with a deep blue color and excellent transparency can reach several hundreds of gold coins per stone. One of the most used items in magical spells that involve affecting the mind. In some regions it is used in creating magical mechanical constructs like golems.

Ironwood Log.name: 铁木原木 Ironwood Log
Ironwood Log.description:
“我们称它为铁木，但通常会根据地区而有它自己的名字。伐木厂的人讨厌这种木材，因为几乎每次他们都得更换主锯片。更别提如果有人想要用它的木料，他们也得准备足够的金币。这东西非常坚韧！”

铁木有多种颜色，从红色到灰色再到明亮的棕色不等，取决于其采伐的地区。它主要用作柴火，因为燃烧得非常缓慢。用于家具时，通常只会作为小型装饰性附加件使用，因为大多数木工工具在雕刻它时效率不高。

"We call it Ironwood, but it usually has its own name depending on the region. The folks at the lumber mills hate this type of wood, as almost every time they have to replace their main blade. Not to mention if anyone wants lumber from it they need to have a proper amount of gold too. It is very resilient!"

Ironwood comes in several colors, ranging from red to gray to bright browns, depending on the region where it was harvested. It is mainly used as firewood as it burns very slowly. When used in furniture, it is usually  only used for small decorative add-ons, as most woodworker tools are not efficient in carving it.

Regal Mark.name: 王室印记 Regal Mark
Regal Mark.description:
当一位国王登上王位时，无论是通过继承、征服还是刺杀，都会为其铸造一枚独一无二的奖章币。这枚金币质奖章中央镶有一颗深红色钻石，用以纪念这一事件，并作为一种快速识别手段，以防国王有朝一日需要混入臣民之中。由于每枚奖章都是独一无二的，且流通数量有限，其中一些拥有足以在整片大陆上购买任何东西的购买力。

When a king ascends to the throne, whether by succession, conquest, or assassination, a unique medallion coin is forged for them. This gold medallion features a dark-red diamond at its center, serving as a commemoration of the event and a means of quick identification if the king ever needs to blend in with their subjects. As each medallion is unique and only a limited number exist in circulation, some have the buying power to purchase anything on an entire continent.

Grapes.name: 葡萄 Grapes
Grapes.description:
大部分葡萄产量用于酿酒，而大多数（如果不是全部）酒馆或旅店都与葡萄园签订了长期合约。它们有多种颜色，如深红、黑色、深蓝、黄色、绿色、橙色、粉色和紫色。它们也可用于制作果酱，或晒干制成葡萄干，然后用于烹饪，最常见于糕点。

Most of the Grape production is used for Wine, and most if not all taverns or inns have long-lasting contracts with vineyards. They come in multiple colors like crimson, black, dark blue, yellow, green, orange, pink, and purple. They can also be used for jams or dried and turned into raisins which are then used in cooking, most often pastries.

Elemental Debt.name: 元素债务 Elemental Debt
Elemental Debt.description:
这种魔法钱币的价值不固定，取决于用来制造它的材料。它主要用作一种即将被消耗的材料，用于具有特定先决条件的法术。含有珍珠、钻石、骨骼与白银的魔法合金常用于制作这些钱币。每枚钱币都刻有代表其可用于何种法术类型的魔法符印，而该符号也决定其价值。这些钱币通常能在拥有具备制造它们能力的魔法学院的大型城市中找到。

This magical coin has an undefined value, which depends on the material used to create it. It is primarily used as a material that is about to be consumed for spells that have specific prerequisites. Magical alloys with pearls, diamonds, bones, and silver are commonly used to make these coins. Each coin bears the magical sygil representing the type of spell it can be used for, and this symbol also determines its value. These coins are typically found in major cities with a magical college that has the ability to craft them.

Pickled Olives.name: 腌橄榄 Pickled Olives
Pickled Olives.description:
腌橄榄可以整颗腌制，也可以塞入蒜瓣或红椒。它们用途广泛，可以加入沙拉，作为独立小吃享用，甚至还可用于各种酒精饮品中。 

Pickled Olives can be prepared whole or stuffed with garlic cloves or red peppers. They are versatile enough to be included in salads, enjoyed as a standalone snack, or even used in various alcoholic beverages.

Black Sapphire.name: 黑色蓝宝石 Black Sapphire
Black Sapphire.description:
主要被称为星光蓝宝石，当被切割成形时，宝石的反射会形成一个清晰的六射线星形。如今它的魔法特性几乎已被遗忘，但人们推测它的魔法涉及时代的流逝以及控制它的能力。

Mainly called Star Sapphire, when cut into shape, the reflection of the gem forms into a distinct, six-rayed star. Its magical proprieties have been almost forgotten these days, but it is assumed that its magic involves the passage of time and the ability to control it.

Zamac.name: 扎马克 Zamac
Zamac.description:
锌合金是一种以锌为基的合金，主要用于珠宝首饰，但也用于制作工具、螺栓和铰链。它尤其适用于使用涂料的场合，因为染料能极其牢固地附着在其上。

Zamac is a zinc-based alloy primarily used in jewelry, but it is also utilized for making tools, bolts, and hinges. It is particularly favored in applications where paint is used, as dyes adhere exceptionally well to it.

Cotton.name: 棉花 Cotton
Cotton.description:
棉花种植相对直接，因为大多数城邦都有专门用于棉花种植的农田地区，因为它是服装和室内装饰中最广泛使用的材料之一。

Cotton farming is relatively straightforward as most city-states have dedicated regions of farmland specifically for it, as it is one of the most widely used materials in clothing and indoor decoration.

Durian.name: 榴莲 Durian
Durian.description:
榴莲果实有着坚硬、圆形、绿色且带刺的外壳，内部是柔软可食的果肉。在大多数热带地区，一旦气温下降，由于果实会突然停止生长，就必须相当迅速地进行采收。尽管它被认为是最令人惊叹的水果之一，但它的气味让大多数普通人敬而远之。它的味道常被拿来与臭鼬喷射物或未经处理的污水相比较。

The durian fruit has a tough, round, green and spiky exterior, with a soft edible core. Its harvesting has to be done rather quickly in most tropical regions, once temperatures drop, as the fruit abruptly stops growing. Even though it is considered one of the most amazing fruits, its odor keeps most common folk at bay. Its smell often being compared to the spray of a skunk or raw sewage.

Basalt Stone.name: 玄武岩石 Basalt Stone
Basalt Stone.description:
玄武岩主要呈深灰色，用于建筑施工中的砌块或地基，也用于铺路石，并被著名石匠用来制作雕像。 

The basalt rock comes mainly in a dark-gray color and is used in construction for building blocks or in the groundwork, or cobblestones and in making statues by famous masons.

Undersea Remains.name: 海底遗迹 Undersea Remains
Undersea Remains.description:
这些骨骼极为稀有，以至于无人能够清楚辨认它们。一些人声称它们属于来自不同位面的不可见恐怖之物，或是一种古老形态的鱼类。由于其复杂的取回过程，这些骨骼受到大多数收藏家的高度重视。

These bones are so rare, that nobody can identify them clearly. Some state that they belong to unseen horrors from different realms, or of an ancient form of fish. These are highly valued by most collectors due to their complex retrieval process.

Kiwifruit.name: 猕猴桃 Kiwifruit
Kiwifruit.description:
常简称为猕猴桃，是一种备受追捧的水果。它可以生吃、制成果汁、用于烘焙食品、水果沙拉、与肉类一起烹制或作为装饰用。

Often shortened to Kiwi, a well sought after fruit. It can be eaten raw, made into juices, used in baked goods, fruit salads, prepared with meat or used as a garnish.

Lemon.name: 柠檬 Lemon
Lemon.description:
普通柠檬的用途几乎无穷无尽。它们被用作清洁用品，因为有助于去油。在烹饪中，它们作为配料用来让食物带点酸味，增添额外的风味。最著名的馅饼之一就是柠檬派。它们也被用于护肤调配物中，有时也作为当地疗法来帮助应对不同的病症。它们也常见于清爽的饮品中

The applications of regular lemons are close to limitless. They are used as cleaning products as they help with degreasing. In cooking they are used as an ingredient to sour foods for a bit of extra tang. One of the most famous pies is the Lemon pie. They are used in concoctions for skincare and sometimes local cures to help with different ailments. They can often be found in refreshing drinks

Covered Fruit Tart.name: 水果挞（覆面） Covered Fruit Tart
Covered Fruit Tart.description:
这种果馅挞的配方相当简单，是大多数家庭与烘焙坊都喜爱的点心。它包含面粉、牛奶、甜味剂（如糖或蜂蜜），以及多种水果。用于馅饼的最常见水果有苹果、梨、樱桃、葡萄等，且常常会将它们混合使用，以创造独特的风味组合。这些果馅挞同样深受冒险者与旅人喜爱。它们能唤起怀旧与对家的向往，并提供令人满足的能量补充，帮助他们继续未来的冒险。

The recipe for this tart is quite simple and is a favorite in most households and bakeries alike. It includes flour, milk, sweeteners such as sugar or honey, and a variety of fruits. The most common fruits used for the pies are apples, pears, cherries, grapes, and many more, and often a mixture of them are used to create unique flavor combinations. These tarts are a beloved treat among adventurers and travelers alike. They evoke feelings of nostalgia and a longing for home, and provide a satisfying energy boost to help them on their future adventures.

Lesser Absinthe.name: 次级苦艾酒 Lesser Absinthe
Lesser Absinthe.description:
苦艾酒传统上是将中性酒精与茴香、苦艾和茴芹的混合物一同蒸馏制成。次级苦艾酒的变体会额外加入少许薄荷提取物，据说这能减轻常与这种饮品相关的幻觉强度。然而，其效果会因饮用者个体差异而大不相同。

Absinthe is traditionally prepared through the distillation of neutral alcohol with a blend of anise, wormwood, and fennel. The Lesser Absinthe variant includes an added touch of mint extract, which is believed to reduce the intensity of hallucinations often associated with the drink. However, the effects can vary greatly depending on the individual who consumes it.

Pickaxe.name: 鹤嘴锄 Pickaxe
Pickaxe.description:
鹤嘴锄，也称为镐锄，是用于破碎岩石、路面或土壤的工具，常用于挖掘、整地、拆除等活动，或采矿等专门用途。

Pickaxes, also referred to as mattocks, are tools used for breaking up rocks, paving, or earth, commonly used in activities such as digging, soil preparation, demolition, or specialized applications like mining.

Spindle.name: 纺锤 Spindle
Spindle.description:
纺锤通常由木材、骨头或金属制成，是用来纺羊毛、丝绸以及其他天然纤维的杆状工具。在织工和裁缝之间，它是他们最珍爱的工具之一。

Commonly made from either wood, bone or metal, the spindle is a rod for spinning wool, silk, and other natural fibers. Among weavers and tailors, it stands out as one of their most cherished tools.

Codex Micologica - A Guide to Mushrooms.name: 《真菌法典——蘑菇指南》 Codex Micologica - A Guide to Mushrooms
Codex Micologica - A Guide to Mushrooms.description:
一本详细的小册子，展示最常见的蘑菇，并按气候、地区和天气分类。《图鉴》提供大量信息，并清晰标示哪些蘑菇可安全食用、可安全酿制、哪些应避免，以及如何将其长期储存。既可在野外携带作为伴侣，也可在炼金术士的实验室中随身携带。

A detailed booklet that showcases the most common mushrooms, categorized by climate, region, and weather. The Codex provides extensive information with clear indications of which mushrooms are safe to eat, safe to brew, which to avoid, and how to store them for extended periods. Carried as a companion both in the wild and in the alchemists' laboratories.

Wardrobe.name: 衣橱 Wardrobe
Wardrobe.description:
由于涉及大量的材料，衣柜通常由小城镇或村庄的木匠按订单制作。

Due to the considerable amount of materials involved, wardrobes are generally made to order by carpenters in smaller towns or villages.

Antlers.name: 鹿角 Antlers
Antlers.description:
鹿、麋鹿、驯鹿或北美驯鹿通常每年都会脱落并重新长出鹿角。由于鹿角具有可替换的特性，它们可以用来制作工具、武器、饰品，甚至玩具。鹿角头饰被萨满、灵性人物以及德鲁伊教团用作领导地位的象征。一些森林住民会将其作为不同尺寸的王冠，献给他们的领主、王子、国王，或视情况而定的皇帝。

Antlers are usually shed and regrown each year by deers, elk, reindeer, or caribous. Due to the replacement nature of the antlers, they can be used to make tools, weapons, ornaments, or even toys. Antler hairdressers are used as a form of leadership by shamans, spiritual figures, and druidic circles. Some forest folk use them as crowns, of different sizes, for their lords, princes, kings, or depending on the case, emperors.

Training Dummy.name: 训练假人 Training Dummy
Training Dummy.description:
训练假人虽然相当罕见，而且往往很快就会被活生生的对练伙伴取代，但它们的用途在于训练新战斗人员的身体姿势与打击技巧。由于它们脆弱且稍微使用就容易损坏，因此十分少见。

While quite rare and often quickly replaced by living partners, training dummies serve the purpose of training new combatants in body positions and strike techniques. Due to their fragility and tendency to break with minimal use, they are rare.

Asparagus.name: 芦笋 Asparagus
Asparagus.description:
它有时也被称为麻雀草，其嫩芽常用作春季蔬菜。它们通常作为开胃菜或蔬菜配菜端上桌。在一些地区，有传言称会为它举办一场节日。  

It is sometimes also named Sparrow Grass, its young shoots are often used as a spring vegetable. They are usually served as an appetizer or a vegetable side dish. In some regions, there is word of a festival held in its honor.

Variscite.name: 绿玉髓 Variscite
Variscite.description:
绿松石，颜色类似翡翠，常被用作服装上的装饰元素。根据传说，如果通过伤口或被摄入体内，它具有对夜行生物有害的毒性特质。

Variscite, resembling Jade in color, is commonly used as a decorative element in clothing. According to belief, it possesses toxic properties harmful to nocturnal creatures if introduced through wounds or ingestion.

Detonator.name: 雷管 Detonator
Detonator.description:
一种深受矿工青睐的工具，与火药炸药结合后，可迅速开凿孔洞或隧道，以到达地下更有价值的金属。然而，由于爆炸偶尔不稳定，以及罕见的弹片损坏矿井支撑的风险，钻机往往是更受偏好的选择。

A tool highly favored by miners, its combination with gunpowder explosive facilitates the rapid creation of holes or tunnels to reach the more interesting metals beneath the ground. Nevertheless, due to the occasional instability of the explosions and the rare risk of shrapnel damaging mine supports, drills tend to be the preferred choice.

Honey.name: 蜂蜜 Honey
Honey.description:
蜂蜜是蜜蜂生产的甜而黏稠的物质，许多寺院常常会养殖蜜蜂来获取蜂蜜。蜂蜜储存在蜂巢内，蜜蜂会用蜡构筑蜂巢结构来盛放蜂蜜。此外，由蜂巢制成的蜂蜡蜡烛也经常用于照明家宅。

Honey, the sweet and viscous substance produced by honey bees, is commonly cultivated by many monasteries. Stored within the hive, honey bees construct honeycomb structures made from wax to contain the honey. Additionally, beeswax candles, derived from the honeycomb, are frequently used for lighting homes.

Fiddle.name: 小提琴 Fiddle
Fiddle.description:
小提琴（fiddle），更常被称为violin，经常用于以舞蹈为重点的音乐。两者的区别在于音乐的演奏方式。fiddle 的特点是快速的节奏和迅速的音符变化，而 violin 通常会产生更柔和的音色，带有更长、可维持的音符。该乐器的名称取决于其演奏的风格。

The fiddle, more commonly known as the violin, is often used for music that focuses on dancing. The distinction between the two lies in how the music is played. The fiddle is characterized by fast rhythms and quick note changes, while the violin typically produces a more mellow sound with longer, sustained notes. The instrument’s name depends on the style in which it is played.

Golden Berry.name: 金色浆果 Golden Berry
Golden Berry.description:
灯笼果有时也被称为地樱桃或黄金莓，因其黄色外观而得名。大多数时候，人们会直接食用，或蘸上甜巧克力。它也可以烹煮，制作精致的果酱、果冻与果泥，或用于异国风味水果沙拉、巴甫洛娃蛋糕与瑞士卷。此外，它还能与少量糖一同在水中小火炖煮，然后用于水果派、蛋糕或酥粒甜点中。

The cape gooseberry is sometimes referred to as either ground cherry or golden berry, due to its yellow color. Most of the time, it is eaten as is or dipped in sweet chocolate. It can also be cooked to make exquisite jams, jellies, and purées, or used in exotic fruit salads, pavlovas, and roulades. Additionally, it can be simmered in water with a little sugar and used in fruit pies, cakes, or crumbles.

Seeds - Pumpkin.name: 种子 - 南瓜 Seeds - Pumpkin
Seeds - Pumpkin.description:
南瓜籽是来自南瓜的小而坚硬的种子。它们可以烘烤后作为零食食用，或用于制作油和其他产品。南瓜籽可能被灌注了治愈疾病的力量，使其成为草药师和那些希望改善健康的人们的宝贵商品。

Pumpkin seeds are small, hard seeds that come from pumpkins. They can be roasted and eaten as a snack or used to make oil and other products. Pumpkin seeds might be imbued with the power to cure illnesses, making them a valuable commodity for herbalists and those seeking to improve their health.

Carnelian.name: 红玉髓 Carnelian
Carnelian.description:
很少被称作 Sard。据说佩戴这颗宝石时，你会感觉幸运女神对你微笑。切割后，它被用作项链或手链的珠子，很少被用作大块板材，例如雕刻成肖像或半身像的设计。

Rarely referred to as Sard. It is stated that when wearing this gemstone, you can feel Lady Luck smile upon you. When cut, it is used as beads for necklaces or bracelets, rarely used as large slabs, as designs carved out for portraits or busts.

Maidenhair.name: 铁线蕨 Maidenhair
Maidenhair.description:
这种草药补剂经常由草药师推荐，主要用于处理血液紊乱。它也因其帮助保持你的记忆敏锐的能力而闻名。

This herbal supplement is frequently recommended by herbalists and is mainly used to address blood disorders. It is also renowned for its ability to help keep your memory sharp.

Chocolate Biscuits with Fillings.name: 夹心巧克力饼干 Chocolate Biscuits with Fillings
Chocolate Biscuits with Fillings.description:
巧克力饼干通常具有酥脆的巧克力外壳，包裹着各种果酱和花生馅料。这些饼干常与茶或果汁一同供应给年轻的平民。 

The chocolate biscuits typically feature a crunchy chocolate exterior that encases a variety of jams and peanut fillings. These biscuits are commonly served with teas or juices for the young commoners.

Cantaloupe.name: 哈密瓜 Cantaloupe
Cantaloupe.description:
哈密瓜经常作为清爽解渴的零食食用，也可以用于各种菜肴和食谱中，例如沙拉、果汁和派。它们有多种颜色，从白色到绿色到橙色到红色不等。

Cantaloupes are often eaten as a refreshing and hydrating snack, and they can also be used in a variety of dishes and recipes, such as salads, juices, and pies. They come in a variety of colors ranging from white, to green, to orange, to red.

Tin.name: 锡 Tin
Tin.description:
由于锡质地柔软，通常会与铜结合，以防止其氧化。除了用于金属的保存之外，没有太多用途。

Tin is usually combined with Copper, due to it being soft, to prevent its oxidation. Doesn't have many uses besides the preservation of metals.

Peach Figs.name: 桃子无花果 Peach Figs
Peach Figs.description:
也被称为扁桃或甜甜圈桃，与其姊妹水果非常相似，但外形呈扁圆形。它们往往更为稀有，因为只有极少数地区种植，不过与其常见的对应物——桃子——相比，它们要甜得多。

Called also the flat peach or doughnut peach, very similar to the sister fruit, but oblate in shape. They tend to be a bit rarer as only very few regions cultivate these, however, compared to their regular counterpart, the peach, they are way sweeter.

Heart.name: 心脏 Heart
Heart.description:
看起来像是舞台道具，不是吗？太闪亮、太完美，就像你会期望从街头魔术师的袖口里垂下来那种东西。然而把一个放在掌心里，你会发誓它贴着你的皮肤在嗡嗡震动，缓慢、稳定，像你自己胸腔回响的回声。我见过久经沙场的佣兵把那东西像诅咒一样丢开，仿佛他们抓到了一只活老鼠。

Looks like a stage prop, doesn’t it? Too shiny, too perfect, the sort of thing you’d expect dangling from a street conjurer’s sleeve. Yet hold one in your palm and you’ll swear it thrums against your skin, slow, steady, like the echo of your own chest. I’ve seen hardened mercenaries drop the thing lika a curse, as if they’d grabbed a live rat.

Mine Cart.name: 矿车 Mine Cart
Mine Cart.description:
它们被创造出来的唯一目的就是清除矿井中的碎石瓦砾，也可以用来把矿工运送到更深处的工作地点。它们通常在一天结束时由平民或牲畜带回入口，但在某些地区已经开发出绳索牵引系统，使拖拽更为轻松。

Created for the sole purpose of removing debris from the mines, they can also be used to transport miners deeper to their working spots. They are usually carried back to the entrance at the end of the day by either commoners or livestock, but in some areas rope-haulage systems have been developed to make pulling easier.

Leather Scroll.name: 皮革卷轴 Leather Scroll
Leather Scroll.description:
在拥有大量毛皮许可的地区，皮革卷轴取代了纸草，成为首选的书写材料。它们通常由绵羊、山羊或小牛的皮制成，经过刮削去除毛发、拉伸，并在框架上晾干。最常见的制作方式是用胶水或线将数块皮革固定在一起。

Leather scrolls in the regions with access to a lot of pelts replaced papyrus as the preferred writing material. They are usually made from sheep, goat, or calf skins that have been scraped to remove the hair, stretched, and dried on a frame. It is most often made by fastening several pieces together, with glue or thread.

Amblygonite.name: 磷铝锂石 Amblygonite
Amblygonite.description:
透明的三斜磷锂铝石是最为稀有的，可被切割为宝石刻面；由于其硬度和韧性较低，镶嵌在首饰上佩戴时容易破裂和磨损。根据民间传说，让其中一颗宝石在舌头上溶解被认为能够治愈内伤。

Transparent amblygonite, which is the most rare, faceted as a gemstone, is prone to breakage and abrasion when worn in jewelry due to its low hardness and toughness. According to folklore, letting one of these gems dissolve on your tongue is believed to heal internal injuries.

Maple Lumber.name: 枫木木材 Maple Lumber
Maple Lumber.description:
该木材主要用于制作家具，也是木地板的最佳选择。

The lumber is mainly used to make furniture and is the best choice for wooden flooring.

Puzzle Box.name: 谜题盒 Puzzle Box
Puzzle Box.description:
这个小玩具附带免责声明，声明其含有小零件。尽管它是机械化的，但谜题盒主要面向幼儿，用以帮助他们进行认知发展。它包含许多小齿轮和齿轮组。然而，当它终于被打开时，父母总会为孩子们留下一个小奖励。

This small toy comes with a disclaimer stating that it contains small parts. While it is mechanized, the Puzzle Box is mostly aimed at young children to help them with cognitive development. It contains many small cogs and gears. However, when it is finally opened, parents always leave a treat for the children.

Dried Meat.name: 肉干 Dried Meat
Dried Meat.description:
肉类风干的过程漫长而繁琐。在某些特定情况下，为了获得最高品质的风干肉，可能需要超过一年的时间。由于其延长的保质期而备受追捧，而且坦白说，根据所用肉类的不同，它非常美味。

The process of drying meat is long and extensive. In some particular cases, for the highest quality of dried meat, it can take over a year. It is highly sought after due to its extended shelf life, and depending on the meat used, it is, quite frankly, delicious.

Toadstool.name: 毒蘑菇 Toadstool
Toadstool.description:
它通常有一个带红色斑点的菌盖，并被认为有毒。若食用，可能导致严重疾病，偶尔会致死。由采集者采收，并被炼金术士用于制作毒药或解毒剂。

It usually has a dotted red cap and is assumed to be poisonous. If eaten it can cause serious illness and on occasion death. Harvested by gatherers and used by alchemists in creating poisons or antidotes.

Mango.name: 芒果 Mango
Mango.description:
芒果的体型、形状、甜度、果皮颜色和果肉颜色会因其生长的树木而异。果肉颜色可能从浅黄色到金色、绿色或橙色不等。在某些地区，它被推测为爱情之果。在其他地区，它被作为友谊的信物赠送。草药师会用蜂蜜、柠檬和芒果调制成糊状物，作为止咳糖浆。 

Depending on the tree it grows on, the mango fruit varies in size, shape, sweetness, skin color, and flesh color. The flesh can range from pale yellow to gold, green, or orange. In some regions, it is speculated to be the fruit of love. In other regions it is given as a token of friendship. Herbalists create a paste with honey, lemon, and mango as a cough syrup.

Hunter's Mark.name: Hunter's Mark
Hunter's Mark.description:
这种造型独特的硬币由贵族发给猎人，作为在其领地上狩猎许可的身份标识，前提是已支付某种形式的费用。狩猎完成后，猎人将硬币归还给贵族，并可选择将猎获物直接卖给他们。通常，猎人与贵族会事先就狩猎利润的分成比例达成一致。该硬币也可以以更高的价格卖给商人银行，使贵族得以腾出手处理其他事务。

This uniquely shaped coin is given by nobles to hunters as identification for permission to hunt on their land, after some form of payment has been made. Once the hunt is complete, the hunter returns the coin to the noble and may choose to sell the hunt directly to them. Typically, the hunter and noble will agree to a percentage of the hunt's profits beforehand. The coin can also be sold to merchant banks at a higher price, freeing the noble to attend to other matters.

Chicken Bones.name: 鸡骨头 Chicken Bones
Chicken Bones.description:
在宰杀鸡只后保存下来，并借助魔法手段或调制出能制造冰冻温度的混合物进行储存。农民通常会将这些与蔬菜残渣一同储存，用来熬制鸡汤或明胶。在最初用于熬制高汤之后，还可以制作复熬汤（remouillage），一种更为清淡的二次高汤。这些骨头也可以被研磨成骨粉，作为当地牲畜的食物补充剂。

Saved after the cutting of a chicken and stored with either magical assistance or brewed concoctions that create freezing temperatures. Farmers typically store these alongside vegetable scraps to make chicken broth or gelatin. After their initial use for stock, remouillage is also made, a second stock that is a bit lighter. The bones can also be ground up for a bone meal as a food supplement for the local livestock.

Silver Ingot.name: 银锭 Silver Ingot
Silver Ingot.description:
银锭一经制成，便有着多种用途，且为各行各业的工匠所追捧。它们可以被制成用于保存葡萄酒与食物的盒子、餐具、精美艺术品、镶嵌宝石的珠宝，甚至是匠心打造的护甲与武器。根据不同地区，银的价格有时甚至能超过最耀眼的明切钻石。

Silver Ingots, once produced, have a multitude of uses and are sought after by craftsmen of all trades. They can be fashioned into boxes that preserve wine and food, cutlery, fine art, gemmed jewelry, and even masterfully crafted armor and weaponry. Depending on the region, silver can sometimes surpass even the most brilliant-cut diamonds in its price.
